metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Use the switch statement to select one of many code blocks to be executed.
content.html: Use the switch statement to select one of many code blocks to be executed.

content.text: The switch statement in Go is similar to the ones in C, C++, Java, JavaScript, and PHP. The difference is that it only runs the matched case so it does not need a break statement.
content.html: The switch statement in Go is similar to the ones in C, C++, Java, JavaScript, and PHP. The difference is that it only runs the matched case so it does not need a break statement.

content.code_html:
switch expression {
case x:
   // code block
case y:
   // code block
case z:
...
default:
   // code block
}

content.text: The example below uses a weekday number to calculate the weekday name:
content.html: The example below uses a weekday number to calculate the weekday name:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
package main
    import ("fmt")
    
    func main() { 
        day := 4 
        switch day {
        case 1:
          fmt.Println("Monday")
        case 2:
          fmt.Println("Tuesday")
        case 3:
          fmt.Println("Wednesday")
        case 4:
          fmt.Println("Thursday")
        case 5:
          fmt.Println("Friday")
        case 6:
          fmt.Println("Saturday")
        case 7:
          fmt.Println("Sunday")
        }
    }

content.code:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
day := 4
switch day {
case 1:
fmt.Println("Monday")
case 2:
fmt.Println("Tuesday")
case 3:
fmt.Println("Wednesday")
case 4:
fmt.Println("Thursday")
case 5:
fmt.Println("Friday")
case 6:
fmt.Println("Saturday")
case 7:
fmt.Println("Sunday")
}
}

content.text: The default keyword specifies some code to run if there is no case match:
content.html: The default keyword specifies some code to run if there is no case match:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
package main
    import ("fmt")
    
    func main() { 
        day := 8 
        switch day {
        case 1:
          fmt.Println("Monday")
        case 2:
          fmt.Println("Tuesday")
        case 3:
          fmt.Println("Wednesday")
        case 4:
          fmt.Println("Thursday")
        case 5:
          fmt.Println("Friday")
        case 6:
          fmt.Println("Saturday")
        case 7:
          fmt.Println("Sunday")
        default:
          fmt.Println("Not a weekday")
        }
    }

content.code:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
day := 8
switch day {

fmt.Println("Monday")

case 4:
fmt.Println("Thursday")
case 5:
fmt.Println("Friday")
case 6:
fmt.Println("Saturday")
case 7:
fmt.Println("Sunday")
default:
fmt.Println("Not a weekday")
}
}

content.text: All the case values should have the same type as the switch expression. Otherwise, the compiler will raise an error:
content.html: All the case values should have the same type as the switch expression. Otherwise, the compiler will raise an error:

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  a := 3

  switch a {
  case 1:
    fmt.Println("a is one")
  case "b":
    fmt.Println("a is b")
  }
}

content.text: Insert the missing parts to complete the following switch statement.
content.html: Insert the missing parts to complete the following switch statement.

content.code_html:
package main   
import ("fmt") 

func main() {
  var day = 2
  switch  {
  (1):
    fmt.Print("Saturday")
  (2):
    fmt.Print("Sunday")    
  }
}
